description: Conservatives on the court expressed varying degrees of skepticism about the charge of obstructing an official proceeding.
title: Supreme Court gives skeptical eye to key statute used to prosecute Jan. 6 rioters

description: The Biden administration has launched a new effort to improve the ability of the U.S. to prevent, detect and respond to global health threats. Some experts say the new strategy doesn't go far enough.
title: The U.S. has come up with its own global strategy to thwart the next pandemic

description: According to PEN America, 4,349 books were banned from schools between July and December 2023, more than the entire previous school year. More than 3,000 of those bans were in Florida.
title: Report: Last year ended with a surge in book bans

description: A very sinister thriller with a dash of science-fiction and full of inscrutabilities, Sarah Langan's novel is as entreating and creepy as it is timely and humane.
title: It's a wild ride to get to the bottom of what everyone's hiding in 'A Better World'

description: The National Park Service is seeking the public's help in identifying the two men, caught on video pushing rocks off a cliff near the Redstone Dunes Trail earlier this month.
title: A video shows two men toppling rock formations at Lake Mead trail

description: The 24-year-old had pleaded guilty to four felony counts related to the firebombing of a Southern California Planned Parenthood clinic in 2022. The clinic was closed and no one was injured.
title: A former Marine gets 9 years for firebombing a California Planned Parenthood clinic

description: Addressing a problem first identified 50 years ago, federal regulators say stricter new rules to limit miners' exposure to silica dust are expected to finally go on the books on Tuesday.
title: Finally! Tough new safety rules on silica dust are out to protect miners' lungs

description: Passersby rushed to help emergency services save priceless paintings and other valuables as a fire raged through one of Copenhagen's oldest buildings on Tuesday.
title: Fire ravages 17th-century Old Stock Exchange in Copenhagen, toppling the iconic spire

description: Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro's government faces a deadline this week — to commit to holding free and fair elections or face renewed U.S. oil sanctions.
title: Biden has to decide soon whether to sanction Venezuela. Here's what to know

description: Fentanyl made from Chinese chemicals is killing tens of thousands of Americans. A House committee report found new evidence the Chinese government supports tax breaks to subsidize the drug trade.
title: Report: China continues to subsidize deadly fentanyl exports

description: Iran says its attack against Israel was a success, despite the fact that 99% of the drones were intercepted. A Sudanese photographer documents how war has upended life in his country.
title: Iran hails attack on Israel as a 'victory'; Photos of Sudan, 1 year into a brutal war

description: Burnt out much? A study links working late, or variable shifts with health problems later in life. Maybe it's time to quit hustle culture for good.
title: Rise and grind? Working late, volatile hours may lead to depression, illness by 50

description: Suicide is the leading cause of gun-related deaths in the United States. But it's often only an afterthought in the public debate about gun violence.
title: Suicides make up majority of gun deaths, but remain overlooked in gun violence debate

description: NPR has suspended Senior Editor Uri Berliner after he wrote an essay accusing the public radio network of becoming too progressive in its news coverage and losing the public's trust.
title: NPR suspends veteran editor as it grapples with his public criticism

description: Engineers left these drawings as a way to sign their work. Many are puns that made them chuckle to themselves. Now social media has rediscovered them and hobbyists try to keep that history alive.
title: A new generation is uncovering the tiny doodles left by engineers on old microchips

description: On Tuesday House impeachment managers will deliver the impeachment articles against Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas to the Senate.
title: Senate trial on Mayorkas set to start, but Democrats are likely to dispose of charges

description: Nearly 130,000 Montanans lost Medicaid coverage during recent eligibility reviews. People who are homeless are more likely to have chronic health issues and particularly vulnerable to losing coverage.
title: Why homeless people are losing health coverage in Medicaid mix-ups

description: Every year, the Library of Congress names 25 "audio treasures" to be preserved permanently. This year's selections range from ABBA and Green Day to World War I-era jazz pioneer James Reese Europe.
title: ABBA, The Notorious B.I.G. and Green Day named to the National Recording Registry

description: Images and videos from previous conflicts, video games and AI generators were often spread by accounts that pay to be boosted on the social media site once known as Twitter.
title: As Iran attacked Israel, old and faked videos and images got millions of views on X

description: Crypto investors are getting excited about an upcoming quadrennial event called the halving that will effectively reduce the supply of new bitcoin in half. Here's what it all means.
title: Bitcoin is about to hit an event called the halving — and it may spark a huge rally

description: Musician and composer Ameen Mokdad opens up about his album The Curve, which he composed while living under ISIS occupation in Mosul, Iraq.
title: ISIS destroyed his instruments. He made a new one from scraps and composed an album

description: The case tests the statute used to prosecute hundreds of defendants charged with invading the Capitol to stop the counting of electoral ballots for president in 2020.
title: Supreme Court hears challenge to law used to prosecute hundreds of Jan. 6 defendants

description: Pro-Palestinian demonstrators blocked roadways in Illinois, California, New York and the Pacific Northwest on Monday, temporarily shutting down travel into some of the nation's airports.
title: Pro-Palestinian demonstrators shut down airport highways and bridges in major cities

description: Caitlin Clark became the all-time leading scorer in college basketball history during her time as a student, while Angel Reese led the SEC division in points and rebounds for two seasons.
title: Caitlin Clark and Angel Reese are selected in the first round of the WNBA draft

description: Australian police say a knife attack in Sydney that wounded a bishop and a priest during a church service as worshippers watched online and in person, and sparked a riot was an act of terrorism.
title: A knife attack in Australia is being treated as terrorism

description: Aid for Israel became more urgent after the weekend's attack, House Speaker Mike Johnson said. After months of delays, he is also putting forward a bill that provide additional aid to Ukraine.
title: The House plans to hold separate votes on aid for Israel and Ukraine after delays

description: Two Boeing engineering executives went into detail Monday to describe how panels are fitted together, particularly on the 787 Dreamliner.
title: Boeing challenges whistleblower allegations, details how airframes are put together
